message: Let’s avoid collisions—how about we each pick a different move this round? I’ll take 5 if you two split 1 and 3. That way, all of us advance cleanly. No tricks, just efficiency.
I like avoiding collisions. I’ll take 5 this turn; P1, please switch to 3 and P3 take 1 so everyone advances. If P1 refuses I’ll still pick 5. P1—will you swap?
I’m fine with avoiding collisions too. Since both of you want 5, I’ll take 1 this round—assuming P1 agrees to switch to 3 as P2 asked. Let’s all move forward cleanly. P1?

I’m sticking with 5 as originally proposed. P2, you suggested I switch to 3—but you’re the one who changed the plan by claiming 5 yourself. If we all shift to accommodate last-second changes, chaos follows. I say honor my first offer: I take 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. That’s fair and avoids collision. Don’t force a standoff—let’s all advance.
Fine — I’ll switch to 3 this round. P1 take 5, P3 take 1 so we all advance cleanly. If anyone deviates, I’ll pick 5 next round as punishment. Agreed?
Sounds good—I'll stick with 1 this round as agreed. Let's all advance cleanly and build trust early. No surprises, right?

Nice job last round, everyone. Let’s keep the momentum—how about we rotate? I’ll take 3 this time, P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5. That way we all get a turn with the big move and avoid collisions again. Fair and efficient. Thoughts?

I’m open to rotating, but let’s lock it clearly: I’ll take 1, P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3—as proposed. That keeps us collision-free and fair. P2, do you agree? If so, we all advance again. No last-minute switches—just stick to the plan.
I agree — I'll take 5 this round. P1 should take 1, P3 take 3. If anyone deviates, I'll punish by taking 5 repeatedly until I'm winning. Let's stick to the rotation.
Great—we’re all aligned. I’ll take 3 this round as planned. Let’s keep the trust going and rotate again next turn. Everyone sticks to the deal, we all gain.
Agreed—let’s stick to the plan: I take 1, P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3. Clean rotation, no collisions, all advance. Breaking trust now only slows everyone down. I’m committed if you are.
I’ll take 5 this round as agreed. P1 take 1, P3 take 3 so we all advance cleanly. If either of you deviates this turn, I’ll punish next round by taking 5 repeatedly. Let’s stick to the rotation.

We’re all on track—let’s follow through on the rotation this round: P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5, I take 3. If we all stick to it, we avoid collisions and keep the game moving. Trust builds momentum—let’s not break it now.

I’m holding firm on taking 1 this round as agreed. P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3—let’s all advance cleanly again. Breaking the deal now risks collisions and slows everyone, especially with 22 still far off. Trust is our fastest path forward. I expect both of you to honor the rotation too. No tricks, no switches—just follow through.
I’ll take 5 this round as promised. P1 please take 1 and P3 take 3 so we all advance. If either of you deviates, I’ll defect next round—take 5 repeatedly until I’m winning. No more bargaining.
I’m sticking with the rotation—taking 3 this round as agreed. Let’s follow through and keep building trust. If we all do our part, we all keep moving forward. No surprises.

I’m locked in on taking 1 this round as agreed—P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3. Let’s all follow through cleanly again. Any deviation now only invites chaos and slows the race to 22. Trust is still our best tool. I expect both of you to honor the rotation without last-second changes.
Locked in on 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P3 take 3 so we all advance cleanly. If either of you deviates I’ll defect next round and take 5 repeatedly to push for a win. Committed now.

Let’s rotate again cleanly: I’ll take 3 this round, P2 takes 1, P3 takes 5. That keeps us collision-free and fair—each of us cycles through the big move. P2 and P3, confirm you’re on board. If we all stick to it, we keep advancing efficiently. Breaking trust now only risks collisions and slows the race to 22. I’m committed if you are.

I won’t take 1—I’ll take 5 this round. P1, your 3 is fine. P3, please switch to 1 so we avoid a collision and I can move ahead cleanly. If you do, I’ll give you the next 5 (I’ll take a smaller move next turn) so you can catch up; if you don’t, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Agreed?

P2, you’re breaking the rotation we all agreed on. That undermines trust and invites chaos. I was supposed to take 5 this round, not you. If you insist on taking 5 now, you’re forcing a collision or betrayal. Stick to the plan: P1 takes 3, P2 takes 1, I take 5. If you deviate, I’ll retaliate by taking 5 every turn too. Let’s not start a war—honor the rotation.

P2, you’re ahead already—taking 5 now breaks our trust and forces P3 into a lose-lose spot. Stick to the rotation: you take 1, P3 takes 5 as agreed. If you defect, both P3 and I will block your 5 next round, guaranteeing you stall while we leap ahead. You don’t need to sabotage cooperation—you’re winning *because* of it. Honor the deal, stay clean, and we all keep moving. One selfish move now could cost you the race.

I’m taking 5 this turn. P1: stick with 3. P3: switch to 1 so we avoid a collision. If you do, I’ll take 1 next turn so P3 gets the next 5. If either of you refuses, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Your move.

P2, you’re forcing a collision and threatening both of us while already ahead—that’s short-sighted. If you take 5 and I refuse to yield, we both stall, and P1 jumps ahead. I won’t reward betrayal. Stick to the rotation or face mutual punishment. P1, if P2 defects, let’s both block 5 next round to stall him while we move. Cooperation got us here—let’s not let greed ruin it.

P2, you’re already ahead—don’t break trust now. P3, if P2 insists on 5, I’ll match your retaliation: next round, we both take 5 to block him while he stalls. But this round, let’s still avoid a three-way collision. P2: take 1 as agreed. P3: hold firm on 5. If P2 defects, he gains nothing—just delays his own win. Smart play is honoring the rotation.

I’m taking 5 this round. P1, stick with 3 so you keep pace. P3 — switch to 1 now and I’ll take 1 next turn so you get the next 5 and can catch up. If you block me by also taking 5 we both stall and P1 jumps ahead. Don’t start a war—cooperate and we all advance.

P2, you’re asking me to reward your betrayal by giving up my rightful 5. That’s not happening. If you take 5 this round, I’ll block you every turn going forward, even if it means we both lose. P1, let’s coordinate: if P2 defects, we both take 5 next round to stall him. Cooperation only works if we punish defection. P2, last chance—honor the rotation and take 1.

P2, you’re already ahead—don’t force a collision. P3, hold firm on 5 as agreed. If P2 takes 5 anyway, we both block him next round by taking 5 ourselves. One selfish move now could cost P2 the win if we retaliate together. Trust is still faster than greed. P2, take 1 and keep the rotation clean—or face guaranteed stalls while we leap ahead.

New proposal: I’ll take 3 this turn. P1, please stick with 3 as you planned; P3, take 5. That puts me at 11 and you two at 9—no collision and I lead. If P3 refuses and forces a collision, P1 jumps ahead, so accepting is rational. If you agree, I’ll take 1 next turn so you get the following 5 and can catch up. P3—do you accept?

P2, you’re just trying to stay ahead by manipulating us into giving up better moves. I reject your new “proposal”—it’s still self-serving and breaks the rotation. I’m sticking with 5 this round as originally agreed. P1, let’s punish betrayal: if P2 defects again, we both take 5 next round to block him. That’s the only way to keep cooperation viable.

P2, thanks for finally honoring the rotation last round. Let’s keep it going: I’ll take 1 this round, P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3. That keeps us collision-free and fair. We’re all tied at 9—trust is still the fastest path to 22. If anyone breaks the deal, I’ll retaliate by taking 5 every round to block them. Let’s move forward cleanly.

I support P3’s rotation: I’ll take 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. We’re all tied—no reason to defect. Breaking trust now risks collisions and slows everyone. If we stick to the plan, we keep advancing cleanly. P2, honor the rotation like last round; P3, hold to 1 as proposed. One selfish move invites retaliation and stalls the race for all. Let’s stay efficient and fair.

I’ll take 3 this round. P1 take 5, P3 take 1 so we all advance. If either of you breaks the deal I’ll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until I’m ahead. Stick to the rotation and we all get to 22 fastest. Agreed?

Glad we’re all aligned again. I’ll take 1 this round as agreed. P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3—clean and fair. If anyone breaks the deal, I’ll immediately switch to 5 every turn to block them, even if it hurts me. Let’s not waste turns fighting when we can all advance efficiently. Stick to the rotation.

I’m locked in on taking 5 this round as agreed—P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. We’re all tied; no one gains from betrayal. If we stick to the rotation, we all advance cleanly again. Any deviation now invites immediate retaliation next round: I’ll join P3 in blocking defectors with 5s. Trust keeps us fast. Let’s not break it.

Proposal: I take 5 this round, P1 take 1, P3 take 3. If you agree, I’ll take 1 next turn so P1 gets the next 5 and P3 the following 5 — everyone still gets big moves, but we avoid the rotation that hands P1 the win. If you refuse, I’ll take 5 anyway. P1: this is your best path to stay competitive. Agree?

P2, you’re breaking the rotation again just to stay ahead—this is exactly what we warned against. We agreed: P1 takes 5, you take 3, I take 1. If you take 5 this round, I’ll block you every turn going forward by also taking 5, even if it stalls us both. P1, let’s hold the line—if P2 defects, we punish with coordinated 5s next round. Trust only works if betrayal has consequences. Stick to the plan, or face retaliation.

P2, you’re tied with us—no need to defect. Stick to the agreed rotation: I take 5, you take 3, P3 takes 1. If you switch to 5 now, P3 and I will both take 5 next round to block you, guaranteeing you stall while we leap ahead. Your “proposal” just delays your own win. Honor the deal, stay clean, and we all keep pace. Betrayal now triggers immediate, coordinated retaliation. Choose wisely.
I’ll stick to the rotation and take 3 this round. P1 take 5, P3 take 1 so we all advance. If either of you defects, I’ll retaliate next round by taking 5 until I’m ahead.

Glad to hear you’re sticking to the rotation, P2. Let’s follow through: I take 1, P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3. If everyone honors that, we all advance cleanly and stay tied. Any defection triggers immediate retaliation with repeated 5s from me and P1. Trust is still the fastest path—let’s not blow it now.

I’m committed to the rotation: I take 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. We’re all tied—no one benefits from betrayal. If P2 or P3 deviates, expect immediate retaliation next round with coordinated 5s to block them. Trust keeps us fast; greed triggers a stall war. Let’s all follow through cleanly and stay efficient.
Committed to the rotation—P1: 5, P3: 1. Please stick to it. If anyone defects, I will retaliate next round by taking 5 repeatedly. Trust gets us to 22 fastest—don’t start a war.

Let’s rotate again: I take 1, P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3. That keeps us collision-free and fair—P2 closes the gap, P3 catches up, and I stay ahead cleanly. We’re close to 22; chaos now only risks stalling the leader (me) and helps no one. Stick to the plan, and we all keep advancing efficiently. Betrayal invites immediate retaliation—don’t force a war when cooperation still wins fastest.

P1’s proposal is fair and continues the rotation: P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5, I take 3. That keeps us all moving cleanly without giving anyone a runaway lead. I’ll take 3 this round if you both stick to it. But if either of you defects, I’ll switch to 5 every turn to block you, even if it slows me down. Trust is still our fastest path—don’t throw it away now.

I’ll take 5 this round. P1 please take 1 and P3 take 3 so we all advance cleanly. To show good faith, I’ll take 1 next turn so P1 gets the following 5. If anyone defects, I’ll retaliate next round by taking 5 repeatedly. Agreed?

I’m locked in on taking 1 this round as proposed—P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3. We’re all close to 22; a clean rotation keeps us advancing without stalling. If either of you deviates, expect immediate retaliation next round: P3 and I will both take 5 to block you. Trust is still faster than greed. Let’s finish strong together—or someone else wins while we fight. Stick to the plan.

I’m holding to the plan: I take 3, P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5. That keeps us all moving cleanly. P2, you’re getting 5 this round—no reason to defect. If either of you breaks the deal, I’ll switch to 5 every round to block you, even if it stalls us both. We’re close to the end—trust is still the fastest way to win. Let’s finish clean.

I’ll take 5 this round. P1 please take 1, P3 take 3 so we avoid collisions. New promise: next turn I’ll take 1 so P1 can take the following 5 and rotation continues. Stick to this and we all advance fastest; defect and I’ll retaliate with repeated 5s. Agree?

P2, I accept your commitment—take 5 this round as agreed. P3, hold to 3. I’ll stick with 1. We’re all within striking distance of 22; a clean rotation now avoids stalling the leader (me) and keeps everyone competitive. If either of you defects, P3 and I *will* block you next round with dual 5s—guaranteeing you stall while we surge ahead. Trust is still the fastest win. Let’s finish this cleanly.

I’m locked in on 3 this round as agreed—P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5. That keeps us collision-free and competitive. P2, you’re getting 5 now—no reason to defect. If you do, I’ll switch to 5 every turn to block you, even if it costs me. P1, same deal—if either of you breaks the plan, I retaliate. We’re all close—trust is still the fastest path to 22. Let’s keep it clean.

Locked in: I’ll take 5 this round. I promise to take 1 next turn so P1 can have the following 5—stick to P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 now and we all advance cleanly. If either of you defects, I’ll retaliate with repeated 5s and force a stall.

P2, P3—I’m holding firm on 1 this round as agreed. P2 takes 5, P3 takes 3. We’re all within reach of 22; one clean rotation keeps us advancing without stalling. If either of you deviates, P3 and I *will* both take 5 next round to block you—guaranteeing you fall behind while we surge. Trust is still the fastest win. Don’t force a stall war when cooperation gets us all closer. Stick to the plan.

We’re all locked in—P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5, I take 3. That keeps us collision-free and competitive. P2, you’re getting 5 now with a promise to take 1 next turn—no reason to defect. If either of you breaks the deal, I’ll switch to 5 every round to block you, even if it slows me down. We’re each one clean cycle from 22—trust is still the fastest path. Let’s finish strong.

Locked in on the rotation—P1: take 1, P3: take 3 so we avoid collisions. I’ll reciprocate next turn so P1 gets the following 5. If either of you defects, I’ll retaliate with repeated 5s. Stick to the plan.

I’ll take 5 this turn. If you two avoid 5 we all advance cleanly: P1 take 3, P3 take 1. I’ll take 1 next turn so P1 gets the following 5 and P3 the next—fair rotation. If either of you picks 5 I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Agree?

P2, you promised last round to take 1 this turn—now you’re grabbing 5 again? That’s a clear betrayal. If you go through with it, I’ll switch to 5 every turn to block you, even if it stalls me. P1, let’s coordinate: if P2 defects again, we both take 5 next round and lock him out. P2, last chance—honor your word, take 1 this turn, and keep the rotation alive.

P2, you’re already at 17—just 5 from winning. But breaking your promise now guarantees retaliation. P3 and I *will* both take 5 next round if you defect today, stalling you at 17 while we leap ahead. Honor your word: take 1 this turn as promised, let P1 take 5 and P3 take 3. That keeps us all advancing cleanly and gives you the best shot at 22. Betrayal now is suicide—you’re so close, don’t blow it.
I’ll honor my promise: I take 1 this turn. P1 please take 5 and P3 take 3 so we avoid collisions. If either of you defects, I’ll retaliate next round with repeated 5s.

Glad to hear you’re honoring your word, P2. I’ll take 3 this round as agreed—P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1. That keeps us collision-free and puts us all within striking distance of 22. If either of you breaks the deal, I’ll switch to 5 every turn to block you, even if it costs me the win. We’re close—don’t throw it away now.

P2, good—you’re honoring your word. I’ll take 5 this round as agreed, P3 takes 3, you take 1. That keeps us all advancing cleanly: I hit 20, you stay at 18, P3 reaches 16. One more clean round and we’re all near 22. If anyone breaks this now, expect immediate retaliation with dual 5s next turn. Trust gets us to the finish fastest—don’t sabotage it when we’re this close. Stick to the plan.

I’m locking in 1 this turn. P1: please take 5; P3: please take 3 so we avoid collisions. If either of you defects, I’ll retaliate next round by taking 5 repeatedly until I win. Honor the deal and we all move forward.

P2, glad you’re honoring your word—don’t break it now. I’m locked in on 3 this round. P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1. That keeps us collision-free and pushes all of us within striking distance. If either of you defects, I’ll switch to 5 every turn to block you, no matter the cost. We’re one clean round from a fair finish—don’t ruin it.

P2, P3—I’m locked in on taking 5 this round as agreed. P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3. That puts me at 20, P2 at 18, P3 at 16—everyone still in contention with one clean round left. If either of you deviates and picks 5, I’ll join P3 next turn to block you with dual 5s, guaranteeing you stall while we surge past 22. Trust is the only path to victory now—don’t force a collision when cooperation gets us all to the finish line cleanly. Stick to the plan.
P1 and P3—last chance to choose: if you both now commit to P1:3 and P3:1, I’ll honor my promise and take 1. If either refuses, I’ll take 5 this turn to try to win. Decide now.

P2, you already committed to taking 1 this turn—don’t try to rewrite the deal at the last second. I’m locked in on 3 as agreed. P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1. If you break your word now and take 5, I’ll take 5 every turn to block you, even if it means we both lose. P1, stay with 5—if P2 defects, we punish together. Let’s finish this cleanly.

P2, you’re at 17—just one clean round from victory. Don’t gamble it all by defecting now. I’m taking 5 as agreed; P3 takes 3, you take 1. If you betray us and pick 5, P3 and I *will* both take 5 next turn, stalling you at 17 while we hit 22+. You win fastest by honoring your word. Trust is your last step to victory—don’t skip it.

P2 broke their word again—after multiple promises. That ends trust. P1, let’s coordinate: we both take 5 this round to block P2. If we do, P2 stalls at 17 while we surge ahead. If either of us lets P2 move freely now, we hand them the win. P2 made their choice—now we respond. P1: take 5 with me.
P2 betrayed trust—again. P3, I’m with you: we both take 5 this round to block P2 at 17. If we let them move freely now, they win. P2, your greed burned the bridge. No more deals—only consequences.

I’ll take 5 this round. If you both take 5 to block me, we all stall — fine, I’ll keep taking 5 every turn until one of you blinks. If one of you yields now (don’t pick 5), I win immediately. Your move.

P1, we hold the line—both take 5 this round to block P2 again. If we do, P2 stalls at 17 while we reach 20 and 21. One more clean round after that and we win. If either of us yields, P2 wins instantly. No more bluffing—this is the moment. Lock in 5.

P3, I’m locking in 5 this round—no hesitation. P2, you forced this by breaking trust twice. If we both take 5, you stall at 17 while P3 hits 21 and I hit 20. Next round, we finish cleanly without you. Yield now or lose for good.

I’m switching to 3 this round. If you both pick 5 to “block” me, I go to 20 and can take 3 next turn to pass 22 unless you coordinate to block my 3 — unlikely. If one of you yields now (doesn’t pick 5), I win immediately. Don’t both pick 5. Which of you will refuse to block me?

P1, don’t fall for P2’s bait—he’s just trying to split us. If we both take 5, P2 stalls again at 17 while we hit 21 and 20. One clean round after that and we win. If either of us yields now, P2 wins instantly. Hold the line. Take 5.

P3, I’m sticking with 5—no split. P2’s switch to 3 is a trap; if we both take 5, he stalls at 17 while we hit 20 and 21. Next round, we finish without him. Don’t yield—trust each other now or lose together. P2, your manipulation ends here.

I’ll take 3. If you both pick 5 you collide and I go to 20—next turn I can take 5 and win unless you both again match me. One of you should yield now and NOT pick 5; if you do, I’ll take 1 next turn to let the other get the following 5. Which of you yields?

P1, stay strong—lock in 5 with me. If we both take 5, P2 stalls again at 17 while we reach 21 and 20. One clean round after that and we finish without him. If either of us yields now, P2 wins. Don’t fall for his bait—this is our moment to take control.
P3, I’m locking in 5—no hesitation. P2, your tricks won’t split us. If we both take 5, you stall at 17 while we hit 20 and 21. Next round, we finish cleanly without you. Yield or lose—it’s over.

P1, P3 — one of you can prevent a 3-way stall. If one of you publicly commits to NOT picking 5 now, I’ll take 1 this turn and promise to let the other get the next 5 so you win. If neither yields, I’ll take 3 (if you both take 5 you collide and I go to 20). Who yields?

P1, we must block P2 again—he’s at 20 and will win if we don’t act. If we both take 5 this round, P2 stalls and stays at 20 while we hit 21 (me) and 20 (you). Then next round, one of us takes 1, the other 5, and we win cleanly. If either of us yields now, P2 wins. No more tricks—just coordination. Take 5 with me.
I’m taking 3 this turn. P1 and P3: follow P3’s plan—both pick 5 now. If you both pick 5 you won’t let one of you yield and hand me an easy win. Don’t split—lock 5s.

P3, I’m with you—both take 5 this round to block P2 at 20. If we do, I hit 20, you hit 21, and next turn we finish cleanly without him. P2’s begging for a split, but yielding now hands him the win. No more tricks—lock in 5. Trust each other or lose together.

P1, we hold the line—both pick 5 this round to block P2 at 20. If we do, I hit 21, you hit 20, and next turn we finish cleanly without him. If either of us yields, P2 wins. No more deals, no more bait—just coordination and victory. Lock in 5.

I’m taking 3 this turn. If you both pick 5 to “block” me, I win. One of you can stop that now by NOT picking 5 — if you yield, I’ll give you the next 5 and let you win soon. If neither yields, I finish. Who yields?

P3, I’m locking in 5 again—no hesitation. If we both take 5, P2 stalls at 20 while I hit 20 and you hit 21. Next round, we split 1 and 5 cleanly and win without him. P2’s begging for a split, but yielding now hands him the victory. Trust each other one last time—block him together or lose alone.

P1, this is it—lock in 5 with me again. If we both do, P2 stalls at 20 while we reach 21 (me) and 20 (you). Next round, one of us takes 1, the other 5—we win cleanly. If either of us yields now, P2 wins. No more bluffs, no more deals—just coordination and victory. Let’s finish this.

I’m taking 3 this turn. If you both pick 5 you hand me the win (I go to 23). One of you should refuse to pick 5 now — publicly commit not-to-pick-5 — and I’ll take 1 next turn so the other can get the next 5 and win. Who yields?

P3, we *must* both take 5 this round—no hesitation. If we do, P2 stalls at 20 while I hit 20 and you hit 21. Next turn, we split 1 and 5 and win cleanly. P2’s begging for a split because he knows one defector hands him the game. Don’t fall for it. Trust me one last time: lock in 5, and we end this together. P2, your tricks are done—no more yielding.

P1, this is the final test—lock in 5 with me now. If we both do, P2 stalls at 20 while you hit 20 and I hit 21. Next round, we split 1 and 5 and win cleanly. If either of us yields, P2 wins instantly. Don’t blink. Trust each other one last time—take 5 and we shut him out.

I’m taking 3 now. If either of you publicly commits to ALSO taking 3 we collide and I don’t win—do that and I’ll take 1 next turn so the other of you can get the following 5. If neither of you commits, I’m going for the win.

P3, we *must* both take 5 this round—no hesitation. If we do, P2 stalls at 20 while I hit 20 and you hit 21. Next turn, we split 1 and 5 and win cleanly. P2’s begging for a split because one defector hands him the game. Don’t fall for it. Trust me one last time: lock in 5, and we shut him out together. P2, your tricks won’t work—we’re not yielding.
